message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Global Financial Development Database, we investigate the relationship between access to finance and firms' ability to innovate.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Development Database"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture in Ethiopia to assess the relationship between drought exposure and household welfare outcomes.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Disaster Risk Management "]}, {"sentence": "We construct novel measures of educational infrastructure using primary data from the Annual Status of Education Report (ASER) in India and investigate their impact on learning outcomes.", "dataset": ["Annual Status of Education Report (ASER)"], "topic": ["Education", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "Considering data from multiple sources including the Food Aid Information System (FAIS), we examine the impact of food aid provision on vulnerable populations with differing levels of nutritional vulnerability.", "dataset": ["Food Aid Information System (FAIS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset from the Nigerian Communication Commission and Electricity Distribution Companies, we explore the causal relationship between electricity provision and economic growth at sub-national levels in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Nigerian Communication Commission", "Electricity Distribution Companies"], "topic": ["Energy", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use multiple datasets to investigate the link between trade costs, market entry, and export success: World Bank's Exporter Dynamics Database, World Integrated Trade Solutions NTM database, and the International Logistics Performance Index.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Exporter Dynamics Database", "World Integrated Trade Solutions NTM database", "International Logistics Performance Index"], "topic": ["Trade", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using high-resolution data from the OpenStreetMap project, we explore how road construction and rehabilitation investments have affected access to healthcare in rural communities.", "dataset": ["OpenStreetMap"], "topic": ["Health", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from multiple sources, including the Global Burden of Disease study and World Health Organization database, to understand the burden of non-communicable diseases and examine the associated risk factors at a global level.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease study", "World Health Organization database"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study exploits new security datasets on Nigeria produced by the Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED) to examine patterns of violence and crime and their impact on economic development in sub-national regions of Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Poverty and Shared Prosperity Database and the World Development Indicators, we assess the relationship between social protection spending and poverty reduction across countries and over time.", "dataset": ["Poverty and Shared Prosperity Database", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
